video.title: TEDTalks: Into the Abyss
video.synopsis: Eerie underwater lakes to sea creatures that glow in the oceans' depths -- marine explorers talk about Earth's blue heart, including its preservation.

episodes.synopsis: Go on a mind-bending trip to hidden underwater worlds to find unexpected life, resources and even new mountains.
episodes.title: Robert Ballard on Exploring the Oceans

episodes.synopsis: Sylvia Earle shares astonishing images of the ocean and shocking stats about its decline as she makes her TED Prize wish.
episodes.title: Sylvia Earle's TED Prize Wish to Protect Our Oceans

episodes.synopsis: In the deep, dark ocean, many creatures make their own light for hunting, mating and self-defense. Meet some glowing friends.
episodes.title: Edith Widder: The Weird, Wonderful World of Bioluminescence

episodes.synopsis: Photographer Brian Skerry shoots life above and below the waves -- as he puts it, both the horror and the magic of the ocean.
episodes.title: Brian Skerry Reveals Ocean's Glory -- and Horror

episodes.synopsis: Having spent decades looking intimately at the ocean, a filmmaker shares his awe and fears about the blue heart of the Earth.
episodes.title: Mike deGruy: Hooked by an Octopus

episodes.synopsis: Coral reef ecologist Jeremy Jackson lays out the shocking state of the ocean today.
episodes.title: Jeremy Jackson: How We Wrecked the Ocean

episodes.synopsis: Tuna are ocean athletes. Marine biologist Barbara Block shares data about these gorgeous, threatened fish and their habitats.
episodes.title: Barbara Block: Tagging Tuna in the Deep Ocean

episodes.synopsis: Peter Tyack of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution talks about a hidden wonder of the sea: underwater sound.
episodes.title: Peter Tyack: The Intriguing Sound of Marine Mammals

episodes.synopsis: Greg Stone tells how he helped the Republic of Kiribati create an enormous protected area in the middle of the Pacific.
episodes.title: Greg Stone: Saving the Ocean One Island at a Time

episodes.synopsis: Scientists are building an underwater network of cameras and sensors that will turn our ocean into a global interactive lab.
episodes.title: John Delaney: Wiring an Interactive Ocean

episodes.synopsis: Kristina Gjerde and other lawyers are working to protect the high seas through smart policymaking and a healthy dose of PR.
episodes.title: Kristina Gjerde: Making Law on the High Seas

episodes.synopsis: Enric Sala shows how we can restore more of our oceans to a healthy, balanced state, and the powerful benefits of doing so.
episodes.title: Enric Sala: Glimpses of a Pristine Ocean

episodes.synopsis: Think of penguins as ocean sentinels, says Dee Boersma -- they're on the frontlines of sea change. What are they telling us?
episodes.title: Dee Boersma: Pay Attention to Penguins
